title: Whitefish Salad
summary: Need a gluten free and pescatarian main course? Whitefish Salad could be a spectacular recipe to try. For $2.66 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. One serving contains 186 calories, 23g of protein, and 9g of fat. This recipe serves 8. This recipe from The Shiksan in the Kitchen has 1 fans. If you have celery stalks, chives, mayonnaise, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 30 minutes. With a spoonacular score of 42%, this dish is pretty good. Similar recipes include Homemade Whitefish Salad, Dinner Tonight: Grilled Whitefish Salad with Tomatoes and Tarragon Vinaigrette, and Whitefish Roll-Ups.

winePairing.pairingText: Fish can be paired with Pinot Grigio, Gruener Veltliner, and Pinot Noir. Fish is as diverse as wine, so it's hard to pick wines that go with every fish. A crisp white wine, such as a pinot grigio or Gr√ºner Veltliner, will suit any delicately flavored white fish. Meaty, strongly flavored fish such as salmon and tuna can even handle a light red wine, such as a pinot noir. You could try Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.5 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 26 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Santa Margherita Pinot Grigio
productMatches.description: A pale straw yellow. Clean, crisp fragrance with intense yet elegant hints of quince. Fresh, harmonious fruit set off by slight sweetness with a long finish full of delicate, tangy flavor.
